alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Magoffin; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 1:57AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Martin. In southeast Kentucky, Floyd, Magoffin and Pike. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 157 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prestonsburg, Forest Hills, Allen, McCombs, Endicott, Gulnare, Ivel, Alvin, Corn Fork Hollow, Emma, Heenan, Moree, Jarad, Banner, Dwale, Allen City, Piso, Lancer and Beaver Junction. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
